page.title: 01River Clyde South of Lanark
page.content: This areais predominantly grazing land for sheep and cattle with very little population. Apart from the A70 it has very quiet country roads. It includes the Corehouse Nature Reserve which is managed by the Scottish Wildlfie trust who promte nature conservation. There are 3 waterefalls which collectively are called the Falls of Clyde. A Hydroelectirc power station situated below Corra Linn waterfall diverts water from above Bonnington Linn thus reducing their flow greatly. West of Hyndford there is a sand and gravel quarrry which also manufactures concrete blocks. This working is not obvious fromthe main road but takes up an increasing amount of land (1km at present). Victorian observation buildings and overgrown gardens in Corehouse, deserted farm dwellings, and the old fording point at Tilliford
